intro: Calceolaria scabiosifolia, commonly known as the woolly slipper orchid, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It is characterized by its distinctive, slipper-shaped flowers that are often brightly colored, ranging from red to orange. The plant has hairy, woolly leaves that give it its common name, and it thrives in cool, moist environments. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. Calceolaria scabiosifolia prefers well-drained soil and partial shade, making it a popular choice for gardeners in temperate climates.
